channel.title: [Release] Automatic donation system
channel.description:
[CENTER][size=14pt]Automatic Daopay donation system v0.1[/size]
removed the download because of ungrateful kids. get the download on other forums.
this script is based on "donator points" as in-game "credits". this script does not save any logs. you'll need a MySQL integrated server for this script to work. i will not help you in any way at all to setup this script, other then on this post. it is 100% secure.
open config.php and you'll see
[CODE]<?php #---- MySQL Connection. ----# define('DB_CONNECT_DB', 'your database'); # Database name. define('DB_CONNECT_IP', 'usually 127.0.0.1'); # MySql IP address. define('DB_CONNECT_LOGIN', 'your db username'); # MySql login. define('DB_CONNECT_PASSWORD', 'your db password'); # MySql password
//Daopay $appcode[1] = 00001; //Application Code (must change to your application code)
$buy_donator_rank_prod_code = 'DR'; //change this to your product code to buy donator rank
$buy_donator_points['DPS15'] = 100; // Array key is the product code, and array value is the amount of donator points given for this product $buy_donator_points_price['DPS15'] = 10; // Amount of $ for this product $buy_donator_points['DPS20'] = 200; // Array key is the product code, and array value is the amount of donator points given for this product $buy_donator_points_price['DPS20'] = 20; // Amount of $ for this product ?>[/CODE]
edit everything to your information.
upload and check if it connects with your database.
this is not a script that leechers should try.[/CENTER]

item.title: [Release] Automatic donation system
item.dc:creator: @Greeny Greeny
item.description:
@Greeny wrote:

[quote=“swescape1, post:19, topic:396337”][quote author=Greeny link=topic=493506.msg3609488#msg3609488 date=1306435849]
Stop referring to us as kids, some of us haven’t been children for quite a while.
[/quote]

well then, stop pretending like you are one.[/quote]

Sorry? I look over this thread and it’s blatantly obvious who is the immature one assuming other’s ages, assuming his work is 100% secure and assuming he should be thanked. You are silly and naive.

[quote=“swescape1, post:22, topic:396337”][quote author=mutex_ link=topic=493506.msg3609992#msg3609992 date=1306475129]

Dear bowser, i know what you mean, but still try to remember that these people with more “knowledge” then me are to greedy to share anything for free. if someone gives you a free porsche you would say thanks, not giving the guy a bunch of criticm about some cracks on the windows, or am i wrong?
[/quote]You should do better on your naming conventions. You should not implement MD5 into your script and claim it is “100% secure” without verifying that, for example, your password hashing methods (MD5) are 100% secure.

Thank you for pointing that out without adding some un-necessary comments.[/quote]

I deem most of the comments in this thread necessary if you are to break out of this immature streak and actually learn something.

Don’t be an arrogant fool and respond so hostile because people don’t thank you for your shit work. If and when you deserve it, you’ll be thanked. It’s not up to you decide that, nor is it up to you to “grade” for lack of a better word, the quality of your work.

Read full topic

[/quote]You should do better on your naming conventions. You should not implement MD5 into your script and claim it is “100% secure” without verifying that, for example, your password hashing methods (MD5) are 100% secure.[/quote]

item.title: [Release] Automatic donation system
item.dc:creator: @Rixxx Rix_
item.description:
@Rixxx wrote:

No one’s pretending like a child here. It’s just you looking forward to a bunch of thank-you replies to a script that needs to be improved. Thanking you for this release (although I didn’t get a chance to see it) would be a lie. If you can’t handle constructive criticism or the blunt truth, don’t bother releasing anything. Toughen up, princess.

mutex_ has pointed out a few mistakes with your script and gave you advice. You’re the one learning, so don’t throw your weight around. He has an award to display his knowledge (or the lack thereof) in web development.

Read full topic

@swescape1 wrote:

i knew you’d say something like that, you totally ignored the message i gave you, and tried to make a fun comment out of it, it doesnt matter if it is a paperbox with square wheels on it, it’s still for free. people can actually gain money from this script without the need of paying lots of cash. get out of your emoerotic sight and see the sun atleast once this year and you’ll see that giving someone a “Thanks” every once in a while isnt that hard, eventho it isnt the best script. everytime someone releases something new on this forum, kids like yourself starts to flame, why not just tell them “pretty good, alltho could need a couple of adjustments”. just give “being nice” a try will ya?

item.title: [Release] Automatic donation system
item.dc:creator: @bowserjr2 Bowser jr
item.description:
@bowserjr2 wrote:

swescape1:

Dear bowser, i know what you mean, but still try to remember that these people with more “knowledge” then me are to greedy to share anything for free. if someone gives you a free porsche you would say thanks, not giving the guy a bunch of criticm about some cracks on the windows, or am i wrong?

Your script isn’t like a Porsche, but more like some sort of cheap car from the 70s.
If you need a secure system, you would rather get some good solution from someone you can trust, even if it cost you money, and not drive a car with lots of holes.

And people here share things for free.

moparisthebest.com

moparisthebest.com

programming, irc, cars


moparisthebest.com

moparisthebest.com

programming, irc, cars


… Scar, Simba, Moparscape and a free Minecraft p-server for everyone to enjoy.

You get free help if you have computer problems, programming problems or homework you are stuck with.

So people here isn’t greedy bastards.

item.title: [Release] Automatic donation system
item.dc:creator: @bowserjr2 Bowser jr
item.description:
@bowserjr2 wrote:

[quote=“swescape1, post:11, topic:396337”][quote author=zachera link=topic=493506.msg3609107#msg3609107 date=1306381644]

wow, why do people keep releasing stuff on this forum? i remove it from this forum now, you can get it from the other more popular forums if you want it, ungrateful kids. it’s free for god sake. instead of complaining about it like a little cunt try using the words “Thanks, maybe some people would use this” or “Thanks for releasing this script for free”

also, sorry for my french, but you deserve it.
[/quote]It’s called constructive criticism.

atleast you tried to be smart, but read that wiki one more time. “the critic has to be in some kind of healthy personal relationship with the other one, which is normally a parent to child, friend to friend, teacher to student, spouse to spouse or any kind of recognized authority in specific field.” i am neither of these to you.[/quote]
Stop quote-mining Wikipedia.

Constructive criticism, or constructive analysis, is a compassionate attitude towards the person qualified for criticism. Having higher experience, gifts, respect, knowledge in specific field and being able to verbally convince at the same time, this person is intending to uplift the other person materially, morally, emotionally or spiritually. For high probability in succeeding compassionate criticism, the critic has to be in some kind of healthy personal relationship with the other one, which is normally a parent to child, friend to friend, teacher to student, spouse to spouse or any kind of recognized authority in specific field. Hence the word constructive is used so that something is created or visible outcome generated rather than the opposite.
The part you're quoting is just saying CC works best if you're fitting that criteria.
  • People are commenting your script to help you do better.
  • You’re posting it here for everyone to see and use.
  • People here have higher experience and knowledge in the subject than you.
    This makes most of the comments here into constructive criticism.
    If I just called you “a stupid heterosexual moron”, it wouldn’t be constructive, but nobody calls you that.

Read full topic

[code]	$Username = isset($_POST['mylogin']) ? strtolower(filter_input(INPUT_POST, 'mylogin', FILTER_SANITIZE_STRING)) : false;
	$Password = isset($_POST['mypassword']) ? strtolower(filter_input(INPUT_POST, 'mypassword', FILTER_SANITIZE_STRING)) : false;[/code]
[code]echo '<script type="text/javascript">alert("'.$notice.'");</script>';[/code]

[img]http://maxcdn.fooyoh.com/files/attach/images/3004/920/472/004/facepalm.jpg[/img]

Also, terrible naming conventions across the entire application...

$Username = isset($_POST['mylogin']) ? strtolower(filter_input(INPUT_POST, 'mylogin', FILTER_SANITIZE_STRING)) : false; $Password = isset($_POST['mypassword']) ? strtolower(filter_input(INPUT_POST, 'mypassword', FILTER_SANITIZE_STRING)) : false;

Also, terrible naming conventions across the entire application…

item.title: [Release] Automatic donation system
item.dc:creator: @swescape1 swescape1
item.description:
@swescape1 wrote:

[CENTER][size=14pt]Automatic Daopay donation system v0.1[/size]

removed the download because of ungrateful kids. get the download on other forums.

this script is based on “donator points” as in-game “credits”.
this script does not save any logs.
you’ll need a MySQL integrated server for this script to work.
i will not help you in any way at all to setup this script, other then on this post.
it is 100% secure.

open config.php and you’ll see

[CODE]<?php
#---- MySQL Connection. ----#
define(‘DB_CONNECT_DB’, ‘your database’); # Database name.
define(‘DB_CONNECT_IP’, ‘usually 127.0.0.1’); # MySql IP address.
define(‘DB_CONNECT_LOGIN’, ‘your db username’); # MySql login.
define(‘DB_CONNECT_PASSWORD’, ‘your db password’); # MySql password

//Daopay
$appcode[1] = 00001; //Application Code (must change to your application code)

$buy_donator_rank_prod_code = ‘DR’; //change this to your product code to buy donator rank

$buy_donator_points[‘DPS15’] = 100; // Array key is the product code, and array value is the amount of donator points given for this product
$buy_donator_points_price[‘DPS15’] = 10; // Amount of $ for this product
$buy_donator_points[‘DPS20’] = 200; // Array key is the product code, and array value is the amount of donator points given for this product
$buy_donator_points_price[‘DPS20’] = 20; // Amount of $ for this product
?>[/CODE]

edit everything to your information.

upload and check if it connects with your database.

this is not a script that leechers should try.[/CENTER]

Read full topic
